ButtonsBar_paragraph_1: It is located on the left side of the editor and is the main ribbon. Below we detail each of the options:
ButtonsBar_paragraph_2: Add new sections to your page; these are grouped by category, and you can select the one that best suits your design.
ButtonsBar_paragraph_3: Here you can choose one of our predefined color palettes, or customize your own.
ButtonsBar_paragraph_4: With this option, you can view your changes in a new window and share the link to your new page with your contacts.
ButtonsBar_paragraph_5: This option allows you to watch the changes made in different sections of the construction page. Please allow yourself to edit the page at any time.
Click on the map to add points. Minimum: Click on the map to add points. Minimum 3 points.

InfoAboutSection:
The About section defines the information for the formal presentation of the company, like an 'About Us'. You can also add more than one for different purposes. This section can be individually customized in terms of background color, text color and size, and the ability to add your own images and logos. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Defines the type of background, either image or color, and includes a color picker so you can choose your preferred color.
 Logo: Allows you to upload your company logo or an image that represents your business, preferably without a background. Accepted formats are png, jpg, jpeg, gif.
 Title: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, and apply margins and line spacing.
 Description: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, and apply margins and line spacing.
 Image: Allows you to upload an image that is displayed next to your text content, and also change the width, height, and margin settings.
InfoBookingSection:
The Booking(*) section allows you to create an interaction form for website visitors to schedule an appointment or make a reservation depending on the type of service offered. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Defines the type of background, either image or color, and includes a color picker so you can choose your preferred color.
 Title: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, as well as the font size, and apply margins and line spacing.
 Paragraph: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, as well as the font size, and apply margins and line spacing.
 Button: Allows you to customize the button color and the text that will appear on the website.
 (*) For this section to be visible on the website, the corresponding settings must be configured in the Booking module of the platform.
InfoCalltoAction:
The CTA (Call To Action) section allows you to customize a call to action for your website. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Defines the type of background, either image or color, and includes a color palette so you can choose your preferred color.
 Title: Allows you to change the text and its color, as well as customize the width of the block where it appears, apply margins, and line spacing.
 Description: Allows you to change the text and its color, as well as customize the width of the block where it appears, apply margins, and line spacing.
 Button: Allows you to style the button, enable/disable it at any time, set a link attribute to choose whether it goes to a section or an external URL, and define the text that will appear on the button.
InfoFooterSection:
The Footer section allows you to customize the bottom part of your new website. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Defines the type of background, either image or color. It also allows you to apply a filter, set the horizontal and vertical position of the image, and select a color from a palette of your choice.
 Logo: Allows you to upload your company logo or an image that represents your business, preferably with no background. Accepted formats are png, jpg, jpeg, gif. You can also adjust its size.
 Description: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, and apply line spacing.
 Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp: Allows you to add social media links and choose whether to display them or not in the section.
 Copyright: Allows you to change the text and choose whether or not to display the copyright notice for your company or the website owner.
InfoGallerySection:
The Gallery section allows you to display a gallery of your own images. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Defines the type of background, either image or color, and includes a color palette so you can choose your preferred color.
 Image: (*) Allows you to upload an image that will be part of the gallery. Supported formats are png, jpg, jpeg, gif, and webp.
 (*) The number of images allowed will depend on the section model you select; it may vary between 4 and 10 images.
InfoHeaderSection:
The Header section displays the top bar of the page. It contains a logo, site navigation menu, and a button. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Allows you to choose the background color of the section or set a transparency.
 Logo: Allows you to upload your company logo or an image that represents your business, preferably with no background. Accepted formats are png, jpg, jpeg, gif, and you can also set its size.
 Navigation: Allows you to choose the menu options that will appear in the navigation bar.
 Button: Allows you to style the button, enable/disable it at any time, assign a link attribute that lets you choose whether it navigates to a section or to a different URL, and finally, define the text that will be displayed on the button.
InfoMenuSection:
The Menu section allows you to organize product or service cards with a brief description of the section. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Defines the type of background, either image or color, and includes a color picker so you can choose your preferred color.
 Title: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, as well as the font size, and apply margins and line spacing.
 Paragraph: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, as well as the font size, and apply margins and line spacing.
 Dishes (*): Allows you to select the products or services that will appear on your website. You just need to select each one, and it will be displayed in the editor in the corresponding section.
 (*) For this section to be visible on the website and for products or services to appear in it, you must first create their respective categories and add the products or services in the Menu module of the platform.
InfoPresentationSection:
The Presentation section displays the main image of the company, along with buttons for more information or contact. Below is a detailed description of each element in the section.
 Background: Allows you to choose the type of background to use, either image or color. It also lets you apply a filter, set horizontal and vertical position of the image, and includes a color picker so you can choose your preferred color.
 Logo: Allows you to upload your company logo or an image that represents your business, preferably with no background. Accepted formats are png, jpg, jpeg, gif, and you can enable/disable it at any time and set its size and bottom margin.
 Title: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, and also apply margins and line spacing.
 Description: Allows you to change the text and its color, customize the width of the block where it appears, and also apply margins and line spacing.
 Button: Allows you to style the button, enable/disable it at any time, assign a link attribute that lets you choose whether it navigates to a section or a different URL, and finally define the text that will be displayed on the button.
